CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, June 26, 1943, pg. 12, reads: "Pittsburgh's Own Son Matriculates at the United States Military Academy - Having completed his studies and received his sheepskin from the University of Pittsburgh. Andrew H. McCoy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew McCoy, Sr. of Terrace Village, will embark upon a military career July 1 when he enters the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.  Mr. McCoy, with a splendid character reference and scholastic background, is the first race youth to be appointed by a Pennsylvania senator.  Honors go to Senator Joseph F. Guffey of Pennsylvania who made the appointment.  Above are pictures of the future Army officer and his loved ones.  Top left is a picture of McCoy in uniform of the ROTC of which he was member at the university.  He served as an officer in the outfit..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Andrew H. McCoy wearing U. S. Army ROTC uniform, standing on sidewalk with Cathedral of Learning in background, University of Pittsburgh, Oakland
